alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 23 at 7:27PM AKDT until March 24 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow with low visibility and wind chills to 50 below occuring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Visibility will be one half mile or less at times. East winds gusting to 40 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 4 PM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East winds gusting to 40 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. Cold wind chills as low as 50 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Winds will decrease Thursday afternoon and visibility will improve then. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means periods of blowing snow will cause travel difficulties.
